item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 12, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. You might not need WebSockets (192 points | 132 comments)
2. Vacheron Constantin breaks the world record for most complicated wristwatch (138 points | 114 comments)
3. Fedora change aims for 99% package reproducibility (332 points | 162 comments)
4. A 32-bit processor made with an atomically thin semiconductor (164 points | 33 comments)
5. Intentionally Making Close Friends (2021) (146 points | 10 comments)
6. Rust to C compiler – 95.9% test pass rate, odd platforms (5 points | discuss)
7. Erlang's not about lightweight processes and message passing (2023) (226 points | 127 comments)
8. Adobe deletes Bluesky posts after backlash (269 points | 373 comments)
9. Once lush Sahara was home to a surprisingly unique group of humans (90 points | 13 comments)
10. Show HN: Omiword – A daily, sector-based word puzzle (32 points | 23 comments)
11. AI Coding and the Peanut Butter and Jelly Problem (63 points | 34 comments)
12. Datastar: Web Framework for the Future? (189 points | 101 comments)
13. Blue Prince is a roguelike puzzle masterpiece (118 points | 75 comments)
14. Bonobos use a kind of syntax once thought to be unique to humans (144 points | 100 comments)
15. Germany creates 'super–high-tech ministry' for research, technology, aerospace (164 points | 168 comments)
16. Key principles on in-game virtual currencies in the EU (50 points | 32 comments)
17. Lead is still bad for your brain (148 points | 129 comments)
18. But what if I want a faster horse? (1249 points | 539 comments)
19. Leaked data reveals Israeli govt campaign to remove pro-Palestine posts on Meta (778 points | 458 comments)
20. Windows 2000 Server named peak Microsoft (127 points | 181 comments)
21. Bilinear interpolation on a quadrilateral using Barycentric coordinates (112 points | 28 comments)
22. Soil from the moon's far side suggests drier conditions than side facing Earth (9 points | discuss)
23. In Guatemala, painted altar found at Tikal adds new context to Maya history (9 points | 2 comments)
24. A recent study suggests that insects branched out from crustaceans (79 points | 81 comments)
25. Strengths Are Your Weaknesses (301 points | 96 comments)
26. WebRTC for the Curious (114 points | 28 comments)
27. Modern 6502 (85 points | 7 comments)
28. Pinball Brothers – A Swedish-Italian Pinball Company (13 points | 4 comments)
29. Mosaic (YC W25) is building a general purpose agent for video editing ( | hide)
30. That groan you hear is users' reaction to Recall going back into Windows (77 points | 63 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 12, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
